channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bird flu begins its human spread, as health officials scramble to safeguard people and livestock
item.description: Some experts say mass human-to-human transmission of this strain of bird flu is only a matter of time.

item.title: Carl Icahn investment-arm shares slide as dividend is again halved
Markets react negatively to China stimulus announcement
S&P 500 seeking to breach 6,000 mark for first time — live coverage
Amazon CEO Andy Jassy hates bureaucracy so much he’s planning to increase the ratio of employees to managers
item.description: The e-commerce giant says bureaucracy creates inefficiency.

item.title: Shares of Icahn's investment arm slump on dividend-cut report
Optimism about U.S. economy at three-year high, consumer-sentiment gauge shows
Black Friday sales flyers are already leaking out, including ones from Walmart, Target and Home Depot
item.description: Start your planning (and in some cases shopping) now.

item.title: Responsible AI Means IT Security Has to Evolve
item.description: Artificial intelligence and IT security are converging. Thoughtful companies will develop processes so AI makes their systems more, not less, secure.

item.title: Temu faces second EU probe for misleading sales practices
item.description: Potential EU fines over misleading practices are escalating the scrutiny of Temu as regulators push the e-commerce giant to comply with consumer-prote...
